Package controller

Class PowerUpController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.PowerUpController
  • public class PowerUpController
extends java.lang.Object
    This Class is used to manage all the possibilities from the PowerUps in the basic implementation of PowerUpCard there is no logic here i want to give game logic to each card

    • Method Detail

      • usePowerUpAsAmmo

        public void usePowerUpAsAmmo​(PowerUp powerUp)
        this method has the powerup in input. the result will be the update of the status of ammo in the player object and the update of the powerup card position (returning to deck) it can only be used when the player has to pay a cost (picking a weapon)
        Parameters:
        powerUp - powerUp to use as ammo

      • useTeleporter

        public void useTeleporter​(PowerUp teleporter,
                          Square destination)
                   throws NotAllowedMoveException,
                          WrongPowerUpException
        Use of teleporter powerup
        Parameters:
        teleporter - powerUp to use (to be brasated from players hand)
        destination - destination of teleporting
        Throws:
        NotAllowedMoveException - never
        WrongPowerUpException - if your're trying to mess with the controller he wont let you use a random powerUp in exchange of a free move

      • useNewton

        public void useNewton​(PowerUp newton,
                      Player affectedPlayer,
                      Square destination)
               throws NotAllowedMoveException,
                      NotInYourPossessException,
                      WrongPowerUpException
        Use of newton powerup
        Parameters:
        newton - powerUp to use (to be brasated from players hand)
        affectedPlayer - player to move
        destination - destination of newtoning (drag the affected player in this positionz)
        Throws:
        NotAllowedMoveException - if you try to move the player in more than one direction or in more than 2 of distance
        NotInYourPossessException - you cannot use a powerUp that you don't have in your hand
        WrongPowerUpException - if your're trying to mess with the controller he wont let you use a random powerUp in exchange of a free move

      • checkSingleDirectionMove

        public boolean checkSingleDirectionMove​(Player affectedPlayer,
                                        Square destination)

      • useTagbackGrenade

        public void useTagbackGrenade​(PowerUp tagbackGrenade,
                              Player user,
                              Player affectedPlayer)
                       throws NotInYourPossessException
        Use of tagback Grenade
        Parameters:
        tagbackGrenade - powerUp to use as tagback, kidding, it has to be a tagback!
        user - who makes the damage
        affectedPlayer - player who gets damage
        Throws:
        NotInYourPossessException - if you are trying to use another thing as a tagback

      • useTargetingScope

        public void useTargetingScope​(PowerUp targetingScope,
                              Color ammoColor,
                              Player affectedPlayer)
                       throws NotInYourPossessException,
                              NotEnoughAmmoException
        use of the targeting scope
        Parameters:
        targetingScope - powerUp to use
        ammoColor - color of ammo to pay
        affectedPlayer - player affected by powerUp's effect (one more damage)
        Throws:
        NotInYourPossessException - if you are trying to use another thing as a targeting scope
        NotEnoughAmmoException - if you cannot pay for the PowerUp
